text: To enable one-way SSL On RCP, follow the steps in this page. You need to prepare a keystore with a certificate and private key before enabling one-way SSL on HTTP. Refer to Configuring a Keystore to create your own Keystore with a trusted certificate and private key. You can also use a keystore that containing a self-signed certificate. The mzsh keytool enable-tls command is no longer available in Mediationzone 9. Steps: Use mzsh topo set to set the value of the RCP TLS Properties listed below in platform container. pico.rcp.tls.keystore pico.rcp.tls.keystore.alias pico.rcp.tls.keystore.password pico.rcp.tls.key.password Restart platform, ec. Example command: restart platform ec1 ec2
title: Enable One-way SSL On RCP - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
